member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ElementLocation

member.summary: Override Equals so that identical fields imply equal objects.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ElementLocation.File
member.summary: The file from which this particular element originated. It may differ from the ProjectFile if, for instance, it was part of an import or originated in a targets file. If not known, returns empty string.
member.returns: Returns .

member.summary: Get reasonable hash code.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ElementLocation.Line
member.summary: The line number where this element exists in its file. The first line is numbered 1. Zero indicates "unknown location".
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ElementLocation.LocationString
member.summary: The location in a form suitable for replacement into a message. Example: "c:\dir\proj.csproj (12,34)" Calling this creates and formats a new string. Only in rare cases should the location go within the message itself.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElement
member.summary: Abstract base class for MSBuild construction object model elements.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElement.AllParents
member.summary: All parent elements of this element, going up to the ProjectRootElement. None if this is a ProjectRootElement. None if this has not been attached to a parent yet.
member.returns: Returns an enumerator over all parent elements. There are no parents elements if the project element is a ProjectRootElement or if this is not yet attached to a parent element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElement.Condition
member.summary: Gets or sets the Condition value. It will return empty string IFF a condition attribute is legal but it’s not present or has no value. It will return null IFF a Condition attribute is illegal on that element. Removes the attribute if the value to set is empty. It is possible for derived classes to throw an if setting the condition is not applicable for those elements.
member.returns: Returns the Condition attribute value. Returns an empty string if the attribute is not present.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElement.ConditionLocation
member.summary: Location of the "Condition" attribute on this element, if any. If there is no such attribute, returns null.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElement.ContainingProject
member.summary: ProjectRootElement (possibly imported) that contains this Xml. Cannot be null.
member.returns: Returns the project root container that contains this project.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElement.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the Label value. Returns empty string if it is not present. Removes the attribute if the value to set is empty.
member.returns: Returns the label. Returns an empty string if no label is present.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElement.LabelLocation
member.summary: Location of the "Label" attribute on this element, if any. If there is no such attribute, returns null;
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElement.Location
member.summary: Location of the corresponding Xml element. May not be correct if file is not saved, or file has been edited since it was last saved. In the case of an unsaved edit, the location only contains the path to the file that the element originates from.
member.returns: Returns .
